title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.16.5-6 | 09-01-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya
Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Namah Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shri Vasadi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Jai Vanarottamam Deveem Saraswateem
Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 5th and 6th verses of the 16th chapter
of the 1st canto of Shri Madbhagavata.
The 5th verse is as follows
Shaunaka Vacha
Kasyahetor Nijagraha Kalim Digvijayendrapaha
Nrudeva Chinha Drakshudra
Kosav Gamya Padahanat
Tatkathyata Mahabhaga Yadi Krishna Kathashrayam
So the meaning of this 5th verse is as follows
Shaunaka Rishi inquired
Suta Goswami is describing
to the sages of Naimisharan.
He did by Shaunaka Rishi vary hundred
Shana because she is inquiring after you heard
that Parachit Maharaja came across a low class person meeting
a cow and a bull.
So he came after wrote on all of this.
And these.

So, Savanaka Rishi's inquiry is very pertinent here. Savanaka Rishi inquired, why did Maharaj Pariksit simply punish him since he was the lowest of the Shudras having dressed as a king and having struck a cow on the leg? Please describe all these incidents if they relate to the topics of Lord Krishna.
So, the sages of Naimisharanya, they are very eager to hear topics connected with Krishna. In the beginning itself, they ask six questions related to Krishna.
So, these questions pertaining to Krishna are completely satisfying to the soul.
To the real self. Therefore, such questions are very, very important.
And answers to such questions can solve all problems, can bring about peace and prosperity in the entire world.
It can purify the heart of the conditioned souls. It brings in all auspiciousness. It brings in enlightenment.
So, therefore, it's so important to discuss these topics.
Now, in the Purpose of the Lord Krishna, there is a very important topic.
What Srila Prabhupada says, Savanaka and the rishis were astonished to hear that the pious Maharaj Pariksit simply punished the culprit and did not kill him.
See, the sages of Naimisharanya, they were expecting Pariksit as the Mahabhagavata, as the ideal king, ideal emperor, ideal ruler,
that he will never...
that he will never tolerate even a little harm done to a cow.
So, why did Pariksit not kill the fellow immediately?
Instead, you are describing Pariksit Maharaj just punished him, spared his life.
So, they were completely astonished to hear.
Why did Pariksit not kill him?
So, Srila Prabhupada further says,
This suggests that a pious king like Maharaj Pariksit should have at once killed an offender who wanted to cheat the public by dressing like a king
and at the same time daring to insult the purest of animals, a cow.
In general, a conditioned soul is inclined to cheat, but this kind of cheating, dressing like a king while actually behaving as the lowest class person,
is real, real big cheating.
Big cheating.
His actions suggest that he is a very low class fellow, but externally he appears to be dressed like a king.
So, this cheating has to be at once stopped.
And how can it be stopped?
Simply kill the fellow on the spot.
No mercy.
No relief for him.
No pardon.
No excuse.
Not at all.
So, Srila Prabhupada says,
The rishis in those days, headed by Saunaka,
however, could not even imagine that in the advanced days of the age of Kali,
the lowest of the shudras will be elected as administrators.
Then there was one person, Parikshit's time.
But now there are so many of, so many people like that Kali Purusha.
And they are the lowest among men in the society, but they are elected as administrators, playing the role of the king.
And such people will open organized slaughterhouses for killing.
Cows.
Mass killing.
They could not even imagine that Kali Yuga, as time progresses, will become so degraded.
Then one person was just beating a cow and a bull.
Just beating, mind you.
That itself, the rishi's reaction was,
He should have immediately killed.
Then what is the punishment for somebody opens a slaughterhouse
and mass killing of cows.
Helplessly, these innocent, pure animals are being killed
by the thousands of, tens of thousands of, lakhs, millions.
Especially in America.
So, because the scriptures say,
a cow killer is punished by Yamaraj
to be sent to hell for punishment for as many years
as there are hair on the body of the cow.
You can imagine how severe the punishment is
if he escapes punishment before he dies.
After death, punishment is abating those who escape punishment before they die.
Suitable punishment.
So, this cow killing is the greatest sin.
Greatest sin.
There can't be any greater sin than cow killing.
So, further Srila Prabhupada says,
Anyway, although hearing about a Shudraka
who was a cheat and an insulter of a cow
was not very interesting to the great rishis.
They nevertheless wanted to hear about it
to see if the event had any connection with Lord Krishna.
See, they are interested in hearing
all topics connected with Krishna.
It doesn't matter what the topic is.
It should be in relationship with Krishna.
That's all they want to hear.
So, Prabhupada says the characteristic of Bhagavatam is
there are so many topics about sociology, politics, economics, cultural affairs.
But all of them are in relation with Krishna.
Therefore, all of them are worth hearing.
Because Krishna is the purifying agent in all these matters.
Everything in this material world
in relationship with the three gunas
is actually impure.
But when dovetailed with Krishna
everything becomes purified.
That's the principle of the Bhagavatam.
The sixth verse.
athavasya padam bhoja makaranda liham satam
kim manyair asad alaapair
ayusho yad asad vyayaha
The meaning of the sixth verse is
The devotees of the Lord are accustomed to licking up the honey available from the lotus feet of the Lord.
What is the use of topics which simply waste one's valuable life?
Characteristic of a devotee of Krishna is
the devotee only wants to hear topics connected with Krishna.
All other topics are waste of time.
So Srila Prabhupada says in the purport
Lord Krishna and his devotees are both on the transcendental plane above the three gunas.
Therefore the topics of Lord Krishna and of his pure devotees are equally good.
Prabhupada gives an example
The battle of Kurukshetra is full of politics and diplomacy.
But because the topics are related with Lord Krishna
the Bhagavad Gita is therefore adored all over the world.
There is no need to eradicate politics, economics, sociology etc.
which are mundane to the mundane-ers.
Some class of philosophers they consider
topics like economics, politics, sociology
connected with this world, the world we live in
as material subject matter
and they don't want to hear at all.
But for a pure devotee
he actually sees everything in relationship with Krishna.
And therefore he is able to relate everything with Krishna.
So that relationship of everything with Krishna is possible
when everything is dovetailed with the Lord's service.
With pure devotional service.
So Prabhupada is explaining
We have heard and talked about the activities of the Pandavas
and we are now dealing with topics of Maharaj Paricharan.
But because all these topics are related to the Supreme Lord Krishna
they are all transcendental and pure devotees
have great interest in hearing them.
You see.
How?
Even the fighting on the battlefield of Kurukshetra
or Paricharan Maharaj dealing with
a low class person who was hurting a cow
these are important for us
because they are in relationship with Krishna.
Because the Pandavas are pure devotees of Krishna
Paricharan Maharaj is a pure devotee of Krishna
therefore those topics are of interest to us
as devotees.
We have already discussed this matter
in connection with the prayers of Bhishma
and Deva.
In the ninth chapter of the first canto
this is discussed in detail.
Our duration of life is not very long
and there is no certainty of when we shall be ordered
to leave everything for the next stage.
Of course we don't die a spirit soul.
But we have to quit this body at a certain time
when ordered to do so.
There is a certain life span
we can live in this body
and we exactly do not know
how many years we are going to live.
It is our duty to see that
not a moment of our life is wasted
in topics which are not related with Krishna.
Somebody who is serious about
self-realization or going back to Godhead
should not waste a valuable time
in this human form of life
in topics which are disconnected from Krishna.
Now, Srila Prabhupada explains
what is this licking up the honey
available at the lotus feet of the Lord.
Prabhupada says
the spiritual planet Goloka Vrindavana
the eternal abode of Krishna
is shaped like the wall of a lotus flower.
Even when the Lord descends to any of the mundane planets
any of the planets in this material world
He does so by manifesting His own abode as it is.
Krishna's abode comes down with Him.
When He comes
His feet remain always on the same
big wall of the lotus flower.
And His feet are also
as beautiful as the lotus flower.
Therefore it is said
Lord Krishna has lotus feet.
You would have heard this many times.
Krishna's feet are described as lotus feet
because His feet are always
resting on the lotus flower.
So there is a certain
honey available
in the lotus flower.
And that honey
is what the devotees are accustomed to tasting
when they take shelter of Krishna's lotus feet.
That's why devotees are attached to Krishna's lotus feet.
And that honey
is as relishable as nectar.
Therefore
constantly the devotees want to
be sheltered by Krishna's lotus feet.
And that's why
it is said
devotees are accustomed to licking up the honey
available from the lotus feet of the Lord.
So to take shelter of the lotus feet of the Lord
means to be engaged always
in a relationship
with
topics of
devotional service to Krishna.
That is the meaning of
taking shelter of the lotus feet of the Lord.
I will stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
